Subjective: Constipation x3 months. Hard stools every 2-3 days. Abdominal cramps and bloating. Negatives: No blood in stool, no urinary changes, no weight loss. Social: Underweight (family history). ICE: Concerned, wants solution.
Objective: Abdomen: Normal bowel sounds, tympanic, tender in lower left quadrant, no rebound or guarding. Urine: No changes. Gynecological: Regular menses.
Assessment: Suspected irritable bowel syndrome with constipation predominance.
Plan: 1. Psyllium fibre sachets daily with ample water x6 weeks. 2. Follow-up in 6 weeks to evaluate. 3. Safety net: Contact if worsening abdominal pain, fever, or bloody stools. 4. Discuss referral to dietician next visit.
